sentence.Network_en: Truscott's verbosity made it hard to separate plain fact from decorative embellishment.
sentence.Network_cn: 特拉斯科特说话啰唆，让人很难分清哪是纯粹的事实哪是添油加醋的修饰之辞。

sentence.Network_en: Locust trees in the North , as a decorative embellishment of nature, also associate us with autumn.
sentence.Network_cn: 北国的槐树, 也是一种能使人联想起秋来的点缀.

sentence.Network_en: I am sensible they might tend very much to the embellishment of my paper.
sentence.Network_cn: 我明知他们也许足以为本报生色.

entry.def: An embellishment is a decoration added to something to make it seem more attractive or interesting.

example.ex: ...public buildings with little bits of decoration and embellishment.
example.tran: 没有太多装潢的公共建筑

means.word_mean: 1. elaboration of an interpretation by the use of decorative (sometimes fictitious) detail;

sentences.sentence: "the mystery has been heightened by many embellishments in subsequent retellings"

means.word_mean: 3. the act of adding extraneous decorations to something
